title: Africa Alive: Rhino calf seen exploring enclosure for first time
article: A six-week-old rhino calf has been seen exploring her enclosure for the first time with her mother. The southern white rhino calf was born on 18 December at Africa Alive in Kessingland, Suffolk, as part of the European breeding programme. On Thursday, the calf was officially named Zawadi, which means "gift" in Swahili, after a public poll. Zawadi's mother Nijiri has been described as an "amazing" first-time parent by keepers. The enclosure is home to five southern white rhinos, which are not officially classed as endangered, but were previously hunted to near-extinction. Due to conservation efforts, numbers of the animals have risen to about 18,000. Find BBC News: East of England on Facebook , Instagram and Twitter .
